explanation: The condition if x>a+1 and x<=b: has an off-by-one error: it wrongly excludes the case x == a+1. The intended check is whether x is strictly greater than a and at most b, i.e. if x>a and x<=b. I fixed that single line to correct the range check.
fixed_code:
a,b,c,x=list(map(int,input().split()))
ans=1.0
if x>a and x<=b:
    ans=c/(b-a)
elif x>b:
    ans=0.0
print('%.10f'%ans)
